snippet: Should we just accept that when you buy a new computer, you should buy it for what it does now, and learn not to resent the fact that, inevitably, there will be better, faster, cheaper computers in the future?
abstract: Should we just accept that when you buy a new computer, you should buy it for what it does now, and learn not to resent the fact that, inevitably, there will be better, faster, cheaper computers in the future?

headline.main: Apple AirPlay and the Window of Obsolescence
